intro: Ecclinusa eximia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are opposite, oval, and covered in fine pubescence. Ecclinusa eximia thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland settings.
